I would suggest:Dark energy = Dark matter = Dark gravity It's the:The seven dimensional parallel universes hovering right above our four dimensional universe:Supermassive blackholes are tunnels connecting between our four dimensional universe and the outer  seven higher vacuumed dimensional universes. Galaxies attracting towards supermassive blackholes will bypass through those tunnels to exit outside in the vacuumed universesKnowing the concept of missing piece (Dark Matter) would Unravel many crises of cosmology, so based on my own model of the shape of the universe,  moreover based on my own model of the creation of the cosmos,  Dark matter existed backwards in time, before the Big Bang. Pre-universe ( Dark Matter) existed  before the Big Bang.The Big Bang happened in the central point of that Pre-universe resulting in formation of galaxies and splitting the outer shell of that pre-universe to seven outer vacuumed parallel universes. Those seven higher vacuumed dimensional parallel universes are what is called Dark Matter. At the same time, those seven higher vacuumed dimensional parallel universes are what is called Dark Energy .Big bang singularity was a central point in four dimensional universe .The Big Bang happened in the central point of the four fundamental universe, resulting in the inflation of that pre-universe and splitting its boundaries to seven outer higher vacuumed dimensional parallel universes with supermassive blackholes embedded in that new structures.Galaxies in our four dimensional universe are flying apart from each other attracting towards that outer seven dimensional higher vacuumed universes ( that is what is called expanding universe) .When the distance between galaxies and the outer higher vacuumed dimensional parallel universes decreases, the expansion of the universe increases ( that is what is known as the acceleration of the expansion of the universe.)Those supermassive blackholes are tunnels connecting between our four dimensional universe and the outer  seven higher vacuumed dimensional universes. Galaxies attracting towards supermassive blackholes will bypass through those tunnels to exit outside in the vacuumed universesHere's my own model of the shape of the universe:Farid Haras, Ph.D

That’s all pure ignorance … gravity is a result of the background permeative particle fields, so there’s no such thing as measuring gravity everywhere.If there exists a balanced mass of galaxies on all sides of you, the background permeative particle fields will simply be slightly weaker, you’ll have no net gravitational pull in any direction, and the gravitational force in your surroundings will be very slightly weaker.A gravitational field is stronger downward permeative particle fields within the space around an object … which is what does the work of pushing nearby matter toward the object.  It’s a natural physical dynamic of particle physics, and the only possible physical mechanism for gravity.https://causeofgravity.com/????????????

It's math. If you have an unknown you label it (usually 'x') for something simple. When you have so many unknown things in the universe, you need to label it something less generic than 'x' in order to do the math and not have two or more unequal things with the same label, Basic math. What's the problem with calling it 'Dark Gravity'. It's gravity from a currently 'unknown' source. Once we have the instruments invented to detect it, we can call it what it is. Nobody knows what it is but we can still do the math to predict its influence.
